summary: Core SDK renamed the `startWorkflow` activation job to `initializeWorkflow` with different ordering and expectations. The TypeScript SDK needs to update its activation handling logic to match this change.
userImpact: Without this update, the TypeScript SDK will be incompatible with the latest Core SDK versions that use the renamed activation job.
rootCause: Core SDK renamed and restructured the startWorkflow activation job to initializeWorkflow with different ordering expectations
proposedFix: Update activation handling logic to expect and process initializeWorkflow jobs instead of startWorkflow
resolutionDetails: Activation handling logic was updated to support the initializeWorkflow job type with new ordering and expectations
keyQuote: Core recently renamed the `startWorkflow` activation job to `initializeWorkflow`, with a different ordering and expectations
